alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Morris; Red River; Titus (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 08 at 3:09PM CST until February 13 at 7:43AM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Shreveport LA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... Sulphur River Near Talco affecting Morris, Franklin, Titus and Red River Counties. For the Sulphur River...including Talco...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sulphur River Near Talco. * WHEN...From this afternoon to Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 27.0 feet, Expect moderate flooding of lowland areas with some secondary roadways closed. All cattle and equipment nearby the river should be moved to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:45 PM CST Wednesday the stage was 22.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:45 PM CST Wednesday was 22.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 27.5 feet early Friday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Sunday afternoon. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 27.5 feet on 05/01/1908. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued Thursday afternoon at 315 PM CST.
